articles.title: 100 Most Common Spanish Words for Couples
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Learning the most common Spanish words is the fastest way to start understanding and communicating in Spanish. Research shows that the top 100 words make up approximately 50% of everyday speech! As a couple learning together, mastering these words will quickly enable basic conversations and build confidence.

This carefully curated list includes the most frequently used Spanish words, organized by category, with pronunciations and examples specifically designed for couples learning together.

## Articles and Pronouns (1-15)

### Articles

| # | Spanish | English | Pronunciation |
|---|---------|---------|---------------|
| 1 | el | the (masc.) | [ehl] |
| 2 | la | the (fem.) | [lah] |
| 3 | los | the (masc. pl.) | [lohs] |
| 4 | las | the (fem. pl.) | [lahs] |
| 5 | un | a/an (masc.) | [oon] |
| 6 | una | a/an (fem.) | [OO-nah] |

### Personal Pronouns

| # | Spanish | English | Pronunciation |
|---|---------|---------|---------------|
| 7 | yo | I | [yoh] |
| 8 | t√∫ | you (informal) | [too] |
| 9 | √©l | he | [ehl] |
| 10 | ella | she | [EH-yah] |
| 11 | nosotros | we | [noh-SOH-trohs] |
| 12 | ellos/ellas | they | [EH-yohs/EH-yahs] |
| 13 | usted | you (formal) | [oos-TEHD] |

<VocabCard
  word="nosotros"
  translation="we"
  pronunciation="[noh-SOH-trohs]"
  example="Nosotros vamos juntos a todas partes."
/>

### Other Important Pronouns

| # | Spanish | English | Pronunciation |
|---|---------|---------|---------------|
| 14 | me | me | [meh] |
| 15 | te | you (object) | [teh] |

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Te quiero"
  translation="I love you"
  pronunciation="[teh kee-EH-roh]"
  context="The pronoun 'te' (you) is essential for expressing love"
/>

## Essential Verbs (16-40)

### Being and Having

| # | Spanish | English | Pronunciation |
|---|---------|---------|---------------|
| 16 | ser | to be (permanent) | [sehr] |
| 17 | estar | to be (temporary) | [ehs-TAHR] |
| 18 | tener | to have | [teh-NEHR] |
| 19 | haber | to have (auxiliary) | [ah-BEHR] |
| 20 | hay | there is/are | [eye] |

<VocabCard
  word="estar"
  translation="to be (temporary states)"
  pronunciation="[ehs-TAHR]"
  example="¬øC√≥mo est√°s? Estoy muy feliz contigo."
/>

### Action Verbs

| # | Spanish | English | Pronunciation |
|---|---------|---------|---------------|
| 21 | ir | to go | [eer] |
| 22 | hacer | to do/make | [ah-SEHR] |
| 23 | poder | to be able | [poh-DEHR] |
| 24 | decir | to say | [deh-SEER] |
| 25 | querer | to want/love | [keh-REHR] |
| 26 | saber | to know (facts) | [sah-BEHR] |
| 27 | conocer | to know (people) | [koh-noh-SEHR] |
| 28 | venir | to come | [beh-NEER] |
| 29 | dar | to give | [dahr] |
| 30 | ver | to see | [behr] |

<VocabCard
  word="querer"
  translation="to want / to love"
  pronunciation="[keh-REHR]"
  example="Te quiero con todo mi coraz√≥n."
/>

### More Essential Verbs

| # | Spanish | English | Pronunciation |
|---|---------|---------|---------------|
| 31 | hablar | to speak | [ah-BLAHR] |
| 32 | comer | to eat | [koh-MEHR] |
| 33 | vivir | to live | [bee-BEER] |
| 34 | pensar | to think | [pehn-SAHR] |
| 35 | sentir | to feel | [sehn-TEER] |
| 36 | amar | to love | [ah-MAHR] |
| 37 | llamar | to call | [yah-MAHR] |
| 38 | esperar | to wait/hope | [ehs-peh-RAHR] |
| 39 | necesitar | to need | [neh-seh-see-TAHR] |
| 40 | gustar | to like | [goos-TAHR] |

<CultureTip title="Ser vs Estar" flag="üá™üá∏">
Spanish has two verbs for "to be" - this is one of the trickiest concepts for English speakers! Use "ser" for permanent characteristics (Soy alto - I am tall) and "estar" for temporary states or locations (Estoy cansado - I am tired). Practice with your partner to master this!
</CultureTip>

## Prepositions and Connectors (41-55)

### Prepositions

| # | Spanish | English | Pronunciation |
|---|---------|---------|---------------|
| 41 | de | of/from | [deh] |
| 42 | en | in/on | [ehn] |
| 43 | a | to/at | [ah] |
| 44 | por | for/by | [pohr] |
| 45 | para | for/in order to | [PAH-rah] |
| 46 | con | with | [kohn] |
| 47 | sin | without | [seen] |
| 48 | sobre | on/about | [SOH-breh] |

<VocabCard
  word="con"
  translation="with"
  pronunciation="[kohn]"
  example="Quiero estar contigo para siempre."
/>

### Conjunctions

| # | Spanish | English | Pronunciation |
|---|---------|---------|---------------|
| 49 | y | and | [ee] |
| 50 | o | or | [oh] |
| 51 | pero | but | [PEH-roh] |
| 52 | que | that/which | [keh] |
| 53 | porque | because | [POR-keh] |
| 54 | si | if | [see] |
| 55 | cuando | when | [KWAN-doh] |

## Question Words (56-63)

| # | Spanish | English | Pronunciation |
|---|---------|---------|---------------|
| 56 | qu√© | what | [keh] |
| 57 | qui√©n | who | [kee-EHN] |
| 58 | c√≥mo | how | [KOH-moh] |
| 59 | d√≥nde | where | [DOHN-deh] |
| 60 | cu√°ndo | when | [KWAN-doh] |
| 61 | por qu√© | why | [por keh] |
| 62 | cu√°l | which | [kwahl] |
| 63 | cu√°nto | how much | [KWAN-toh] |

<PhraseOfDay
  word="¬øC√≥mo est√°s, mi amor?"
  translation="How are you, my love?"
  pronunciation="[KOH-moh ehs-TAHS mee ah-MOR]"
  context="Use question words daily to communicate with your partner"
/>

## Adjectives (64-80)

### Descriptive Adjectives

| # | Spanish | English | Pronunciation |
|---|---------|---------|---------------|
| 64 | bueno/a | good | [BWEH-noh] |
| 65 | malo/a | bad | [MAH-loh] |
| 66 | grande | big | [GRAHN-deh] |
| 67 | peque√±o/a | small | [peh-KEH-nyoh] |
| 68 | nuevo/a | new | [NWEH-boh] |
| 69 | viejo/a | old | [bee-EH-hoh] |
| 70 | mucho/a | much/many | [MOO-choh] |
| 71 | poco/a | little/few | [POH-koh] |

<VocabCard
  word="mucho"
  translation="much / a lot"
  pronunciation="[MOO-choh]"
  example="Te quiero mucho, much√≠simo."
/>

### More Useful Adjectives

| # | Spanish | English | Pronunciation |
|---|---------|---------|---------------|
| 72 | mejor | better/best | [meh-HOR] |
| 73 | mismo/a | same | [MEES-moh] |
| 74 | otro/a | other/another | [OH-troh] |
| 75 | todo/a | all/every | [TOH-doh] |
| 76 | primero/a | first | [pree-MEH-roh] |
| 77 | √∫ltimo/a | last | [OOL-tee-moh] |
| 78 | feliz | happy | [feh-LEES] |
| 79 | triste | sad | [TREES-teh] |
| 80 | hermoso/a | beautiful | [ehr-MOH-soh] |

## Nouns (81-95)

### Essential Nouns

| # | Spanish | English | Pronunciation |
|---|---------|---------|---------------|
| 81 | el amor | love | [ehl ah-MOR] |
| 82 | la vida | life | [lah BEE-dah] |
| 83 | el tiempo | time | [ehl tee-EHM-poh] |
| 84 | la casa | house | [lah KAH-sah] |
| 85 | el d√≠a | day | [ehl DEE-ah] |
| 86 | la noche | night | [lah NOH-cheh] |
| 87 | el hombre | man | [ehl OHM-breh] |
| 88 | la mujer | woman | [lah moo-HEHR] |
| 89 | la persona | person | [lah pehr-SOH-nah] |
| 90 | el coraz√≥n | heart | [ehl koh-rah-SOHN] |

<VocabCard
  word="el coraz√≥n"
  translation="the heart"
  pronunciation="[ehl koh-rah-SOHN]"
  example="Mi coraz√≥n es tuyo para siempre."
/>

### More Common Nouns

| # | Spanish | English | Pronunciation |
|---|---------|---------|---------------|
| 91 | la palabra | word | [lah pah-LAH-brah] |
| 92 | el momento | moment | [ehl moh-MEHN-toh] |
| 93 | la mano | hand | [lah MAH-noh] |
| 94 | el mundo | world | [ehl MOON-doh] |
| 95 | el lugar | place | [ehl loo-GAHR] |

## Adverbs and Other Words (96-100)

| # | Spanish | English | Pronunciation |
|---|---------|---------|---------------|
| 96 | no | no/not | [noh] |
| 97 | s√≠ | yes | [see] |
| 98 | m√°s | more | [mahs] |
| 99 | muy | very | [mwee] |
| 100 | ya | already/now | [yah] |

<VocabCard
  word="m√°s"
  translation="more"
  pronunciation="[mahs]"
  example="Te amo m√°s cada d√≠a."
/>

## Practice Exercises for Couples

### Exercise 1: Daily Word Challenge
Each day, pick 5 words from this list. Use each word in a sentence to your partner.

**Example:** Words: amor, querer, mucho, con, feliz
- "El amor es hermoso" (Love is beautiful)
- "Te quiero mucho" (I love you a lot)
- "Estoy muy feliz contigo" (I'm very happy with you)

### Exercise 2: Mini Conversations
Use only words from this list to have simple conversations:

**Partner A:** ¬øC√≥mo est√°s?
**Partner B:** Estoy bien. ¬øY t√∫?
**Partner A:** Muy feliz porque estoy contigo.
**Partner B:** Yo tambi√©n. Te quiero.

### Exercise 3: Build Sentences Together
Take turns adding words to build longer sentences:

- A: "Yo"
- B: "Yo quiero"
- A: "Yo quiero estar"
- B: "Yo quiero estar contigo"
- A: "Yo quiero estar contigo para siempre"

<CultureTip title="Frequency Matters" flag="üá™üá∏">
Studies show that learning the most common words first accelerates language acquisition dramatically. These 100 words appear in almost every Spanish conversation. Master them, and you'll understand roughly half of what you hear! Focus on these before expanding your vocabulary.
</CultureTip>

## Bonus: Common Phrases Using These Words

### Romantic Phrases

| Spanish | English | Words Used |
|---------|---------|------------|
| Te quiero mucho | I love you a lot | te, querer, mucho |
| Eres mi vida | You are my life | ser, mi, vida |
| Quiero estar contigo | I want to be with you | querer, estar, con, t√∫ |
| Eres todo para m√≠ | You are everything to me | ser, todo, para, yo |
| Te amo con todo el coraz√≥n | I love you with all my heart | te, amar, con, todo, coraz√≥n |

### Everyday Phrases

| Spanish | English | Words Used |
|---------|---------|------------|
| ¬øQu√© quieres hacer hoy? | What do you want to do today? | qu√©, querer, hacer, hoy |
| Vamos a la casa | Let's go home | ir, a, la, casa |
| ¬øD√≥nde est√°s? | Where are you? | d√≥nde, estar |
| No s√© | I don't know | no, saber |
| Tengo mucho que decir | I have a lot to say | tener, mucho, que, decir |

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Eres la mejor persona del mundo"
  translation="You are the best person in the world"
  pronunciation="[EH-rehs lah meh-HOR pehr-SOH-nah dehl MOON-doh]"
  context="A loving compliment using 6 words from this list!"
/>

## Memorization Tips for Couples

1. **Flashcard dates**: Quiz each other with flashcards during dinner or walks
2. **Label your home**: Put Spanish labels on items around your house
3. **Daily goals**: Aim to use 10 words from this list each day
4. **The 5-word game**: Pick 5 random words and make a story together
5. **Spanish minutes**: Have 5 minutes of only Spanish conversation daily

## Your Foundation for Fluency

These 100 words are your building blocks for Spanish fluency. As a couple, you have a built-in practice partner, which gives you a huge advantage! Use these words in your daily conversations, build sentences together, and watch how quickly your Spanish improves.

Remember, language learning is a journey best taken together. Every word you master brings you closer to fluency - and closer to each other.

<CTA text="Ready to master these 100 words together?" buttonText="Start Learning Now" />

import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Uzywanie pieszczotliwych zwrotow w jƒôzyku partnera to wspanialy spos√≥b na poglebienie waszej wiezi. Turecki ma niezwykle bogata tradycje zdrobnien - poetyckich, emocjonalnych i pelnych ciepla. Jezeli uczysz siƒô [jak powiedziec "kocham cie" po turecku](/learn/pl/tr/how-to-say-i-love-you-in-turkish/), te zwroty sƒÖ idealnym uzupelnieniem!

## Klasyczne tureckie zdrobnienia

<VocabCard
  word="canƒ±m"
  translation="moja duszo / kochanie"
  pronunciation="dza-nim"
  example="Nasƒ±lsƒ±n canƒ±m?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="a≈ükƒ±m"
  translation="moja milosci / kochanie"
  pronunciation="asz-kim"
  example="G√ºnaydƒ±n a≈ükƒ±m!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="hayatƒ±m"
  translation="moje ≈ºycie / kochanie"
  pronunciation="ha-ja-tim"
  example="Seni √∂zledim hayatƒ±m."
/>

<CultureTip title="Skad siƒô biora tureckie zdrobnienia?" flag="üáπüá∑">
Tureckie zdrobnienia czesto pochodza od slow zwiazanych z dusza (can), ≈ºyciem (hayat), swiatlem (nur) i serduszkiem (ciƒüer). To pokazuje gleboka wartosc, jaka Turcy przyk≈Çadaja do bliskich osob!
</CultureTip>

## Zdrobnienia duchowe i emocjonalne

Turcy uwielbiaja poetyckie, duchowe zdrobnienia:

<PhraseOfDay
  word="bir tanem"
  translation="moj jedyny/a"
  pronunciation="bir ta-nem"
  context="Jedno z najbardziej romantycznych tureckich zdrobnien"
/>

| Turecki | Wymowa | Polski |
|---------|--------|--------|
| **canƒ±m** | dza-nim | duszo moja |
| **g√∂z√ºm** | go-zum | oko moje |
| **bir tanem** | bir ta-nem | moj jedyny/a |
| **ciƒüerim** | dzi-e-rim | moja watrobko (bardzo czule!) |
| **canƒ±m ciƒüerim** | dza-nim dzi-e-rim | duszo moja, watrobko (polaczenie) |

## Zdrobnienia slodkie

<VocabCard
  word="tatlƒ±m"
  translation="slodki/slodka moja"
  pronunciation="tat-lim"
  example="Tatlƒ±m, gel buraya!"
/>

| Turecki | Wymowa | Polski |
|---------|--------|--------|
| **tatlƒ±m** | tat-lim | slodki/slodka moja |
| **≈üekerim** | sze-ke-rim | cukiereczku moj |
| **balƒ±m** | ba-lim | miodku moj |
| **ku≈üum** | ku-szum | ptaszku moj |
| **kedicim** | ke-di-dzim | koteczku moj |

<CultureTip title="'Ciƒüerim' - watroba jako zdrobnienie!" flag="üáπüá∑">
W tureckiej kulturze "ciƒüerim" (moja watrobko) jest jednym z najbardziej czulych zdrobnien! Watroba symbolizuje gleboka milosc i przywiazanie. Nie zdziw sie, gdy us≈Çyszysz to od tureckiego partnera!
</CultureTip>

## Zdrobnienia dla mezczyzn

<VocabCard
  word="yakƒ±≈üƒ±klƒ±m"
  translation="przystojniaku moj"
  pronunciation="ja-ki-szik-lim"
  example="G√ºnaydƒ±n yakƒ±≈üƒ±klƒ±m!"
/>

| Turecki | Wymowa | Polski |
|---------|--------|--------|
| **yakƒ±≈üƒ±klƒ±m** | ja-ki-szik-lim | przystojniaku moj |
| **aslanƒ±m** | as-la-nim | lwie moj |
| **prensim** | pren-sim | ksieciu moj |
| **bebeƒüim** | be-be-im | male≈Ñstwo moje |
| **ko√ßum** | ko-czum | baranie moj (dosl., ale czule) |

## Zdrobnienia dla kobiet

<VocabCard
  word="g√ºzelim"
  translation="piƒôkna moja"
  pronunciation="gu-ze-lim"
  example="ƒ∞yi ak≈üamlar g√ºzelim!"
/>

| Turecki | Wymowa | Polski |
|---------|--------|--------|
| **g√ºzelim** | gu-ze-lim | piƒôkna moja |
| **tatlƒ±m** | tat-lim | slodka moja |
| **prensesim** | pren-se-sim | ksiezniczko moja |
| **meleƒüim** | me-le-im | aniele moj |
| **g√ºl'√ºm** | gu-lum | rozo moja |

## Zabawne i unikalne zdrobnienia

<VocabCard
  word="pi≈üpirik"
  translation="maluszku (bardzo czule, slangowe)"
  pronunciation="pisz-pi-rik"
  example="Gel buraya pi≈üpirik!"
/>

| Turecki | Wymowa | Polski |
|---------|--------|--------|
| **pi≈üpirik** | pisz-pi-rik | maluszku |
| **tombi≈üko** | tom-bisz-ko | pulpeciku |
| **pon√ßik** | pon-czik | paczuszku |
| **papatyam** | pa-pa-tjam | stokrotko moja |
| **yƒ±ldƒ±zƒ±m** | jil-di-zim | gwiazdo moja |

## Kiedy uzywac poszczegolnych zdrobnien

Nie wszystkie zdrobnienia sa odpowiednie w kazdej sytuacji. Oto przewodnik:

### Przy rodzinie partnera
Bezpieczne i akceptowane:
- **"canƒ±m"** - uniwersalne, mozna uzywac przy rodzicach
- **"tatlƒ±m"** - delikatne, odpowiednie przy rodzinie
- **"hayatƒ±m"** - romantyczne, ale akceptowane publicznie

### Na osobnosci
Bardziej intymne zwroty:
- **"a≈ükƒ±m"** - bardzo romantyczne
- **"bir tanem"** - gleboko osobiste
- **"ciƒüerim"** - bardzo czule, raczej prywatnie

### W wiadomosciach i rozmowach telefonicznych
- **"canƒ±m"**, **"a≈ükƒ±m"** - zawsze odpowiednie
- Emotikony serduszka czesto towarzysza zdrobnieniom

<CultureTip title="Wskazowka kulturowa" flag="üáπüá∑">
Turcy sa bardzo ciepli i ekspresywni w okazywaniu uczuc. Uzywanie zdrobnien przy rodzinie partnera jest calkowicie normalne i mile widziane - pokazuje, ze naprawde ci zalezy!
</CultureTip>

## Zdrobnienia regionalne i rodzinne

<CultureTip title="Roznice regionalne" flag="üáπüá∑">
W roznych regionach Turcji mo≈ºna uslyszec rozne zdrobnienia. W Stambule popularne jest "canƒ±m", podczas gdy w Anatolii cze≈õƒáiej uslyszysz "yavrum" (moje pisklƒô).
</CultureTip>

### Tradycyjne tureckie:
- **"yavrum"** [jaw-rum] - moje dziecko/pisklƒô
- **"evladƒ±m"** [ew-la-dim] - moje dziecko
- **"g√∂z√ºm"** [go-zum] - oko moje
- **"g√∂z√ºm√ºn nuru"** [go-zu-mun nu-ru] - swiatlo moich oczu

### Nowoczesne i miejskie:
- **"bebeƒüim"** [be-be-im] - kochanie (od "baby")
- **"a≈üko"** [asz-ko] - kochanie (slangowe)
- **"bebe"** [be-be] - male≈Ñstwo

## Jak uzywac zdrobnien naturalnie

### Na poczatek dnia
**"G√ºnaydƒ±n canƒ±m!"** [gu-naj-din dza-nim] (Dzie≈Ñ dobry, duszo moja!)

### Podczas rozmowy
**"Ne d√º≈ü√ºn√ºyorsun a≈ükƒ±m?"** [ne du-szu-nu-jor-sun asz-kim] (Co myslisz, kochanie?)

### Na po≈ºegna≈Ñie
**"G√∂r√º≈ü√ºr√ºz hayatƒ±m!"** [go-ru-szu-ruz ha-ja-tim] (Do zobaczenia, ≈ºycie moje!)

### W wiadomosciach tekstowych
- **"Seni √∂zledim canƒ±m"** [se-ni oz-le-dim dza-nim] (Tesknie, duszo)
- **"Seni seviyorum a≈ükƒ±m"** [se-ni se-wi-jo-rum asz-kim] (Kocham cie, kochanie)
- **"ƒ∞yi geceler tatlƒ±m"** [i-ji ge-dze-ler tat-lim] (Dobranoc, slodka)

## Tworzenie zdrobnien w tureckim

Turecki pozwala latwo tworzyc zdrobnienia dodajac przyrostek **"-im"** (moj/moja):

| Slowo bazowe | + przyrostek | Zdrobnienie |
|--------------|--------------|-------------|
| **can** (dusza) | + ƒ±m | **canƒ±m** |
| **a≈ük** (milosc) | + ƒ±m | **a≈ükƒ±m** |
| **hayat** (≈ºycie) | + ƒ±m | **hayatƒ±m** |
| **tatlƒ±** (slodki) | + m | **tatlƒ±m** |

<CultureTip title="Harmonia samogloskowa" flag="üáπüá∑">
W tureckim przyrostek zmienia siƒô w zaleznosci od ostatniej samogloski s≈Çowa: -im, -ƒ±m, -um, -√ºm. To siƒô nazywa harmonia samogloskowa!
</CultureTip>

## ƒÜwiczenia dla par

### Gra w zdrobnienia
Kazdy dzie≈Ñ uzywajcie innego zdrobnienia i zobaczcie, ktore wam najbardziej odpowiada!

### Tworzcie w≈Çasne
Turecki jest idealny do tworzenia w≈Çasnych zdrobnien - dodajcie "-im" do ulubionego s≈Çowa!

### Praktyka dzie≈Ñna
Sprobujcie uzywac przynajmniej trzech roznych zdrobnien ka≈ºdego dnia:
1. Rano: **"G√ºnaydƒ±n canƒ±m"**
2. W ciagu dnia: **"Nasƒ±lsƒ±n a≈ükƒ±m?"**
3. Wieczorem: **"ƒ∞yi geceler hayatƒ±m"**

## Ucz sie z tureckich seriali (diziler)

Tureckie seriale (diziler) to fantastyczny sposob na nauke zdrobnien w naturalnym kontekscie. Oto najpopularniejsze:

### Polecane seriale romantyczne:
- **"Kara Sevda"** (Wieczna milosc) - pelen emocjonalnych scen z "canƒ±m", "a≈ükƒ±m"
- **"Sen √áal Kapƒ±mƒ±"** (Zapukaj do moich drzwi) - nowoczesna komedia romantyczna
- **"Erkenci Ku≈ü"** (Wczesny ptak) - lekka i zabawna, swietna na poczatek

<CultureTip title="Wskazowka do nauki" flag="üáπüá∑">
Ogladaj z tureckimi napisami! Zwracaj uwage, jak bohaterowie uzywaja zdrobnien w roznych sytuacjach - przy rodzinie, na osobnosci, w klotniach i pojednaniach.
</CultureTip>

## Zdrobnienia w tureckiej muzyce

Turecka muzyka ludowa i popularna jest pelna pieknych zdrobnien. Piosenki o milosci czesto uzywaja slow jak "canƒ±m", "sevgilim" (ukochany/a) i "y√ºreƒüim" (serce moje).

## Podsumowanie

Tureckie zdrobnienia dodaja ciepla i intymnosci do codzie≈Ñnej komunikacji. Zacznijcie od klasykow jak "canƒ±m" i "a≈ükƒ±m", a z czasem odkryjecie, ktore zwroty najlepiej pasuja do waszego zwiazku.

Pamietajcie - najwazniejsza jest szczerosc i czulosc, z jaka uzywacuie tych slow!

## Kontynuuj nauke

- **[Jak powiedziec "kocham cie"](/learn/pl/tr/how-to-say-i-love-you-in-turkish/)** - Romantyczne wyznania
- **[Tureckie powitania](/learn/pl/tr/turkish-greetings-farewells/)** - Codzie≈Ñne zwroty
- **[Slownictwo na randke](/learn/pl/tr/turkish-date-night-vocabulary/)** - Romantyczny s≈Çownik
- **[Podstawy gramatyki](/learn/pl/tr/turkish-grammar-basics/)** - Buduj solidne podstawy

## Od czytania do mowienia

Znasz juz ponad 50 tureckich zdrobnien - ale czy potrafisz je poprawnie wymowic? Turecki ma unikalne dzwieki, ktore trudno opanowac z samego czytania.

<CTA
  text="Chcesz powiedzieƒá 'canƒ±m' z idealnƒÖ wymowƒÖ? Z Love Languages ƒáwiczysz z AI Voice Chat - bez stresu i oceniania. Tw√≥j turecki partner mo≈ºe wysy≈Çaƒá Ci ulubione zdrobnienia jako Word Gifts prosto do Twojego s≈Çownika. Nauka we dwoje dzia≈Ça!"
  buttonText="Ucz siƒô tureckiego z partnerem"
/>

articles.title: Italian Shopping Vocabulary: Essential Words for Going to the Store Together
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Shopping in Italy is an experience! From bustling markets to charming boutiques, knowing the right vocabulary will help you navigate any shopping situation with your partner. Whether you're buying groceries together or browsing for the perfect gift, let's learn to shop in Italian!

## Types of Shops

| Italian | English | What You'll Find |
|---------|---------|------------------|
| **Il supermercato** | Supermarket | Groceries, household items |
| **Il mercato** | Market | Fresh produce, local goods |
| **La panetteria** | Bakery | Bread, pastries |
| **La pasticceria** | Pastry shop | Cakes, sweets |
| **La macelleria** | Butcher | Meat |
| **La pescheria** | Fish shop | Seafood |
| **La farmacia** | Pharmacy | Medicine, cosmetics |
| **L'edicola** | Newsstand | Papers, magazines |
| **La boutique** | Boutique | Clothing, accessories |
| **Il negozio di scarpe** | Shoe store | Footwear |
| **La gioielleria** | Jewelry store | Jewelry |
| **La profumeria** | Perfume shop | Perfumes, cosmetics |

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Andiamo a fare la spesa insieme?"
  translation="Shall we go grocery shopping together?"
  pronunciation="ahn-dee-AH-mo ah FAH-reh lah SPEH-zah in-see-EH-meh"
  context="A romantic way to turn a chore into quality time"
/>

<CultureTip title="Shop Hours in Italy" flag="üáÆüáπ">
Many Italian shops still close for lunch (pausa pranzo), typically from 1:00-4:00 PM. Plan your shopping accordingly! Sundays and Monday mornings are often quiet - many small shops are closed. Supermarkets usually have longer hours.
</CultureTip>

## Basic Shopping Phrases

### Entering and Greeting

<VocabCard
  word="Buongiorno, posso aiutarla?"
  translation="Good morning, can I help you?"
  pronunciation="bwohn-JOR-no, POS-so ah-yoo-TAR-lah"
  example="Shop assistant: Buongiorno, posso aiutarla? You: S√¨, grazie, cerco..."
/>

| Italian | English |
|---------|---------|
| Buongiorno | Good morning/afternoon |
| Sto solo guardando | I'm just looking |
| Cerco... | I'm looking for... |
| Avete...? | Do you have...? |
| Dov'√®...? | Where is...? |
| Quanto costa? | How much does it cost? |

### Asking for Help

<VocabCard
  word="Mi scusi, dove posso trovare...?"
  translation="Excuse me, where can I find...?"
  pronunciation="mee SKOO-zee, DOH-veh POS-so tro-VAH-reh"
  example="Mi scusi, dove posso trovare il pane?"
/>

| Italian | English |
|---------|---------|
| Pu√≤ aiutarmi? | Can you help me? |
| Mi pu√≤ consigliare? | Can you recommend something? |
| Ce ne sono altri? | Are there other ones? |
| Posso vedere quello? | Can I see that one? |
| Ha qualcosa di pi√π...? | Do you have something more...? |

## At the Grocery Store

### Common Food Items

| Italian | English | Pronunciation |
|---------|---------|---------------|
| **Il pane** | Bread | eel PAH-neh |
| **Il latte** | Milk | eel LAHT-teh |
| **Le uova** | Eggs | leh OO-oh-vah |
| **Il formaggio** | Cheese | eel for-MAHD-jo |
| **La carne** | Meat | lah KAR-neh |
| **Il pollo** | Chicken | eel POL-lo |
| **Il pesce** | Fish | eel PEH-sheh |
| **La frutta** | Fruit | lah FROOT-tah |
| **La verdura** | Vegetables | lah ver-DOO-rah |
| **La pasta** | Pasta | lah PAH-stah |
| **Il riso** | Rice | eel REE-zo |
| **L'olio** | Oil | LOH-lee-oh |

<VocabCard
  word="Abbiamo bisogno di latte e uova"
  translation="We need milk and eggs"
  pronunciation="ahb-BEE-ah-mo bee-ZON-yo dee LAHT-teh eh OO-oh-vah"
  example="Cosa ci manca? Abbiamo bisogno di latte e uova."
/>

### Fruits and Vegetables

| Italian | English |
|---------|---------|
| **Le mele** | Apples |
| **Le arance** | Oranges |
| **Le banane** | Bananas |
| **L'uva** | Grapes |
| **Le fragole** | Strawberries |
| **I pomodori** | Tomatoes |
| **Le patate** | Potatoes |
| **Le cipolle** | Onions |
| **L'aglio** | Garlic |
| **L'insalata** | Lettuce/Salad |
| **Gli spinaci** | Spinach |
| **I peperoni** | Peppers |

<CultureTip title="Market Etiquette" flag="üáÆüáπ">
At Italian markets, you often shouldn't touch the produce yourself! Wait for the vendor to pick items for you, or ask "Posso?" (May I?) before selecting. Vendors take pride in choosing the best items for their customers.
</CultureTip>

### Quantities and Measurements

<VocabCard
  word="Un chilo di pomodori, per favore"
  translation="A kilo of tomatoes, please"
  pronunciation="oon KEE-lo dee po-mo-DOR-ee, per fah-VO-reh"
  example="Buongiorno! Un chilo di pomodori e mezzo chilo di fragole, per favore."
/>

| Italian | English |
|---------|---------|
| Un chilo | A kilogram |
| Mezzo chilo | Half a kilo |
| Un etto (100g) | 100 grams |
| Due etti | 200 grams |
| Un litro | A liter |
| Una bottiglia | A bottle |
| Un pacchetto | A packet |
| Una scatola | A box |
| Una dozzina | A dozen |
| Un po' di | A bit of |

## Clothing and Fashion Shopping

### Basic Phrases

<VocabCard
  word="Posso provarlo?"
  translation="Can I try it on?"
  pronunciation="POS-so pro-VAR-lo"
  example="Che bello questo vestito! Posso provarlo?"
/>

| Italian | English |
|---------|---------|
| Dov'√® il camerino? | Where's the fitting room? |
| Ce l'avete in altre taglie? | Do you have it in other sizes? |
| Ce l'avete in altri colori? | Do you have it in other colors? |
| √à troppo grande | It's too big |
| √à troppo piccolo | It's too small |
| Mi sta bene | It fits me well |
| Mi piace | I like it |
| Lo/La prendo | I'll take it |

### Sizes

| Italian | English |
|---------|---------|
| La taglia | The size |
| Piccolo (S) | Small |
| Medio (M) | Medium |
| Grande (L) | Large |
| Il numero (scarpe) | Shoe size |
| Che taglia porti? | What size do you wear? |

<VocabCard
  word="Come mi sta?"
  translation="How does it look on me?"
  pronunciation="KO-meh mee stah"
  example="Amore, esci dal camerino! Come mi sta questo vestito?"
/>

### Clothes Vocabulary

| Italian | English |
|---------|---------|
| **La camicia** | Shirt |
| **La maglietta** | T-shirt |
| **I pantaloni** | Pants |
| **I jeans** | Jeans |
| **Il vestito** | Dress |
| **La gonna** | Skirt |
| **La giacca** | Jacket |
| **Il cappotto** | Coat |
| **Le scarpe** | Shoes |
| **Gli stivali** | Boots |
| **La borsa** | Bag/Purse |
| **La sciarpa** | Scarf |
| **I guanti** | Gloves |
| **Il cappello** | Hat |

### Complimenting Your Partner

<VocabCard
  word="Ti sta benissimo!"
  translation="It looks great on you!"
  pronunciation="tee stah beh-NEE-see-mo"
  example="Wow! Ti sta benissimo quel vestito! Devi comprarlo!"
/>

| Italian | English |
|---------|---------|
| Ti sta benissimo! | It looks great on you! |
| Sei bellissimo/a! | You look beautiful! |
| Ti dona molto | It really suits you |
| √à perfetto per te | It's perfect for you |
| Che elegante! | How elegant! |

## Paying

<VocabCard
  word="Quant'√® in tutto?"
  translation="How much is it in total?"
  pronunciation="kwahn-TEH in TOOT-toh"
  example="Va bene, prendo tutto. Quant'√® in tutto?"
/>

| Italian | English |
|---------|---------|
| Quanto costa? | How much does it cost? |
| Quant'√®? | How much is it? |
| Il prezzo | The price |
| In saldo/In svendita | On sale |
| Lo sconto | Discount |
| C'√® uno sconto? | Is there a discount? |
| Posso pagare con carta? | Can I pay by card? |
| Pago in contanti | I'll pay cash |
| Lo scontrino | The receipt |
| Potrebbe incartarlo? | Could you wrap it? |
| √à un regalo | It's a gift |

<CultureTip title="Sales in Italy" flag="üáÆüáπ">
Italian sales (saldi) are regulated by law and happen twice a year: winter sales (January-February) and summer sales (July-August). These are the best times for bargains! Look for signs saying "Saldi" or "Svendita."
</CultureTip>

## At the Market

### Market Phrases

<VocabCard
  word="Sono freschi questi pomodori?"
  translation="Are these tomatoes fresh?"
  pronunciation="SO-no FRES-kee KWES-tee po-mo-DOR-ee"
  example="Buongiorno! Sono freschi questi pomodori? Sono di oggi?"
/>

| Italian | English |
|---------|---------|
| √à fresco? | Is it fresh? |
| Di oggi? | From today? |
| Di dove sono? | Where are they from? |
| Sono buoni? | Are they good? |
| Basta cos√¨ | That's enough |
| Ancora un po' | A little more |
| Questo qui | This one here |
| Quello l√¨ | That one there |

<VocabCard
  word="Mi dia quello che ha di pi√π maturo"
  translation="Give me the ripest one you have"
  pronunciation="mee DEE-ah KWEL-lo keh ah dee pyoo mah-TOO-ro"
  example="Vorrei un melone. Mi dia quello che ha di pi√π maturo, per favore."
/>

## Shopping Together: Couple Phrases

<VocabCard
  word="Ti piace questo? Lo prendiamo?"
  translation="Do you like this? Shall we get it?"
  pronunciation="tee pee-AH-cheh KWES-toh? lo pren-dee-AH-mo"
  example="Guarda questo vaso! Ti piace? Lo prendiamo per casa?"
/>

| Italian | English |
|---------|---------|
| Cosa ne pensi? | What do you think? |
| Ti piace? | Do you like it? |
| √à troppo caro | It's too expensive |
| Ne abbiamo gi√† | We already have it |
| Ne abbiamo bisogno? | Do we need it? |
| Compriamolo! | Let's buy it! |
| Torniamo un'altra volta | Let's come back another time |
| √à perfetto per... | It's perfect for... |

### Gift Shopping

<VocabCard
  word="Cerco un regalo per il mio/la mia partner"
  translation="I'm looking for a gift for my partner"
  pronunciation="CHER-ko oon reh-GAH-lo per eel MEE-oh/lah MEE-ah"
  example="Buongiorno, cerco un regalo per la mia fidanzata. Cosa mi consiglia?"
/>

| Italian | English |
|---------|---------|
| √à per un regalo | It's for a gift |
| Potete incartarlo? | Can you gift wrap it? |
| Avete una confezione regalo? | Do you have gift wrapping? |
| Qualcosa di speciale | Something special |
| Qualcosa di romantico | Something romantic |

## Sample Shopping Dialogues

### At the Market

**Vendor:** Buongiorno! Cosa le do?
**You:** Buongiorno! Vorrei un chilo di pomodori e mezzo chilo di mozzarella.
**Vendor:** Ecco a lei. Altro?
**Partner:** S√¨, anche due etti di prosciutto, per favore.
**Vendor:** Perfetto. Sono 12 euro in tutto.
**You:** Ecco, grazie mille!
**Vendor:** Grazie a voi, buona giornata!

### At a Clothing Store

**You:** Scusi, posso provare questo vestito?
**Assistant:** Certo! Il camerino √® laggi√π. Che taglia?
**You:** La 42, grazie.
*In the fitting room...*
**Partner:** Come ti sta?
**You:** Non so... ti piace?
**Partner:** Ti sta benissimo! Sei bellissima!
**You:** Allora lo prendo! Quanto costa?
**Assistant:** √à in saldo, sono 45 euro.

## Practice Exercises for Couples

### Exercise 1: Make a Shopping List
Create a shopping list in Italian for:
- A romantic dinner at home
- A weekend picnic
- Daily groceries

### Exercise 2: Role Play Shopping
Practice these scenarios:
- Buying fruit at a market
- Trying on clothes together
- Looking for a gift

### Exercise 3: Price Check
Practice asking about prices and quantities:
- Quanto costa...?
- Ne vorrei un chilo/etto/due...

## Quick Reference Card

| Need | Italian |
|------|---------|
| How much? | Quanto costa? |
| I'm looking for... | Cerco... |
| Do you have...? | Avete...? |
| Can I try it on? | Posso provarlo? |
| Too big/small | Troppo grande/piccolo |
| I'll take it | Lo prendo |
| Cash or card | Contanti o carta |
| Receipt please | Lo scontrino, per favore |
| It's a gift | √à un regalo |
| Thank you | Grazie |

<VocabCard
  word="Fare shopping insieme √® sempre divertente"
  translation="Shopping together is always fun"
  pronunciation="FAH-reh SHOP-ping in-see-EH-meh eh SEM-preh dee-ver-TEN-teh"
  example="Adoro fare shopping con te. √à sempre divertente!"
/>

Shopping in Italian opens up a world of experiences, from local markets to designer boutiques. Practice these phrases with your partner and turn everyday errands into language-learning adventures. **Buono shopping!** (Happy shopping!)

<CTA text="Ready to shop in Italian together?" buttonText="Start Learning Now" />

articles.title: Hollandaca Mesajlasma Dili: Partnerinizle Dijital Iletisim
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Modern iliskilerde mesajlasma vazgecilmez bir iletisim aracidir. Hollandali partnerinizle mesajlasirken kullanilan kisaltmalari, emojileri ve g√ºnl√ºk yazisma dilini √∂grenmek, iletisiminizi daha dogal ve samimi hale getirecek. Bu rehberde Hollandaca dijital iletisim d√ºnyasina dalacagiz.

## Temel Hollandaca Kisaltmalar

<PhraseOfDay
  word="idd = inderdaad"
  translation="Gercekten / Kesinlikle"
  pronunciation="in-der-dat"
  context="En yaygin onay kisaltmasi"
/>

### Yaygin Kisaltmalar

| Kisaltma | Tam Hali | Anlam |
|----------|----------|-------|
| **idd** | inderdaad | gercekten |
| **oke/ok** | ok√© | tamam |
| **iig** | in ieder geval | her hal√ºkarda |
| **gwn** | gewoon | sadece/normal |
| **ff** | even | bir dakika/biraz |
| **thnx/thx** | thanks/bedankt | tesekk√ºrler |
| **sws** | sowieso | zaten/her hal√ºkarda |
| **egt** | echt | gercekten |
| **wss** | waarschijnlijk | muhtemelen |
| **bv** | bijvoorbeeld | √∂rnegin |

<CultureTip title="Hollanda Kisaltma K√ºlt√ºr√º" flag="üá≥üá±">
Hollandalƒ±lar pratik ve dogrudan iletisimi sever. Kisaltmalar sadece hizi degil, ayni zamanda samimiyeti de g√∂sterir. "Ff" (even) en cok kullanilan kisaltmalardan biridir - "ff wachten" (bir dakika bekle) gibi.
</CultureTip>

## Romantik Mesajlasma Kisaltmalari

<VocabCard
  word="ik hou van je / ihvj"
  translation="Seni seviyorum"
  pronunciation="ik hau fan ye"
  example="Welterusten, ihvj! ‚ù§Ô∏è"
/>

### Ask Dili Kisaltmalari

| Kisaltma | Tam Hali | Anlam |
|----------|----------|-------|
| **ihvj** | ik hou van je | seni seviyorum |
| **ihmj** | ik mis je | seni √∂zledim |
| **lief** | lief | tatli/sevgili |
| **x / xxx** | kus(je) | √∂p√ºc√ºk(ler) |
| **knuf** | knuffel | sarilma |
| **lieverd** | lieverd | sevgilim |

### Sevgi S√∂zc√ºkleri Kisaltmalari

| Kisaltma | Tam Hali | Anlam |
|----------|----------|-------|
| **schat** | schatje | tatliim |
| **lief** | liefje | sevgilim |
| **xx** | kusjes | √∂p√ºc√ºkler |
| **knuff** | knuffel | sarilma |

<VocabCard
  word="Hoi schat, hoe gaat het?"
  translation="Merhaba tatliim, nasilsin?"
  pronunciation="hoy s-hat hoe hat het"
  example="Samimi bir selamlama"
/>

## G√ºnl√ºk Konusma Kisaltmalari

### Soru ve Cevaplar

| Kisaltma | Tam Hali | Anlam |
|----------|----------|-------|
| **hgt?** | hoe gaat het? | nasilsin? |
| **wdk?** | wat doe je? / wat denk je? | ne yapiyorsun? |
| **wbj?** | waar ben je? | neredesin? |
| **wrm?** | waarom? | neden? |
| **wnt?** | wanneer? | ne zaman? |
| **gn idee** | geen idee | fikrim yok |
| **nee joh** | nee joh | hayir ya |
| **ja toch** | ja toch | evet tabii |

### Yanitlar

| Kisaltma | Tam Hali | Anlam |
|----------|----------|-------|
| **goed** | goed | iyi |
| **prima** | prima | harika |
| **top** | top | s√ºper |
| **niet zo** | niet zo goed | pek iyi degil |
| **mwah** | mwah | √∂yle b√∂yle |
| **balen** | balen | berbat/sinir bozucu |

<CultureTip title="Hollanda Dogrudan Iletisimi" flag="üá≥üá±">
Hollandalƒ±lar dogrudan ve d√ºr√ºst iletisimi tercih eder. Mesajlasmada da bu √∂zellik g√∂r√ºl√ºr. "Mwah" (√∂yle b√∂yle) gibi ifadeler yaygƒ±ndƒ±r ve belirsizlik degil, d√ºr√ºstl√ºk g√∂sterir.
</CultureTip>

## Emojiler ve Anlam

Hollandalilar emoji kullanir ama bazi Kuzey Avrupalilar gibi biraz daha √∂lc√ºl√ºd√ºrler:

### Romantik Emojiler

| Emoji | Hollandaca Anlami | Kullanim |
|-------|-------------------|----------|
| ‚ù§Ô∏è | liefde | sevgi ifadesi |
| üòò | kusje | √∂p√ºc√ºk |
| ü•∞ | verliefd | asik |
| üíï | hartjes | kalpler |
| üòç | verliefd | bayiliyorum |
| ü§ó | knuffel | sarilma |

### G√ºnl√ºk Emojiler

| Emoji | Hollandaca Anlami | Kullanim |
|-------|-------------------|----------|
| üòÇ | haha | cok komik |
| üëç | top/oke | tamam/iyi |
| üôè | alsjeblieft/dank | l√ºtfen/tesekk√ºrler |
| üòä | blij | mutlu |
| ü§î | hmm | d√ºs√ºn√ºyorum |
| üò¥ | moe | yorgunum |

## Mesaj √ñrnekleri

### Sabah Mesaji

<VocabCard
  word="Goedemorgen schat! ‚òÄÔ∏è Hoe heb je geslapen? Ihvj ‚ù§Ô∏è"
  translation="G√ºnaydƒ±n tatliim! Nasil uyudun? Seni seviyorum"
  pronunciation="hu-de-mor-hen s-hat hoe hep ye he-sla-pen ihvj"
  example="Romantik sabah mesaji"
/>

### G√ºn Ici Mesajlasma

**√ñrnek Konusma:**

A: "Hoi lief, wdk?" *(Merhaba sevgilim, ne yapiyorsun?)*
B: "Hey! Op werk. En jij?" *(Hey! Isteyim. Sen?)*
A: "Ik ook. Ihmj! üòò" *(Ben de. Seni √∂zledim!)*
B: "Ik jou ook ‚ù§Ô∏è Vanavond zien?" *(Ben de seni. Bu aksam g√∂r√ºs√ºr m√ºy√ºz?)*
A: "Top! Ihvj" *(S√ºper! Seni seviyorum)*

### Aksam Mesaji

<VocabCard
  word="Welterusten liefje, slaap lekker üíï Ihvj heel veel!"
  translation="Iyi geceler sevgilim, iyi uykular. Seni cok seviyorum!"
  pronunciation="vel-te-rus-ten lif-ye slap le-ker ihvj hel fel"
  example="Romantik iyi geceler mesaji"
/>

## Plan Yapma Mesajlari

<VocabCard
  word="Heb je vanavond tijd? üçïüé¨"
  translation="Bu aksam vaktin var mi?"
  pronunciation="hep ye fa-na-font tayt"
  example="Randevu teklifi"
/>

### Plan Ifadeleri

| Mesaj | Anlam |

articles.title: Engelse Huwelijksuitdrukkingen: Romantische Zinnen voor Jullie Grote Dag
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

# Engelse Huwelijksuitdrukkingen: Romantische Zinnen voor Jullie Grote Dag

Er gaat niets boven de magie van een bruiloft, en als je partner Engels spreekt of je wordt uitgenodigd voor een Engelse bruiloft, wil je natuurlijk de juiste woorden paraat hebben. Of het nu gaat om je eigen geloften, een toast op het bruidspaar, of gewoon hartelijke felicitaties - met deze gids ben je perfect voorbereid op elke romantische gelegenheid.

In dit artikel delen we de mooiste Engelse huwelijksuitdrukkingen, van de ceremonie tot de receptie. Leer hoe je je gevoelens kunt uitdrukken en maak indruk op je partner en de gasten met je taalvaardigheid. Bekijk ook onze [Engelse koosnaampjes](/nl/blog/english-pet-names-and-endearments) om je partner extra speciaal te laten voelen.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Will you marry me?"
  translation="Wil je met me trouwen?"
  pronunciation="WIL joe MEH-rie mie"
  context="De ultieme vraag - gebruik dit voor je aanzoek"
/>

## Essenti√´le Huwelijkswoordenschat

Voordat we dieper ingaan op de zinnen, is het belangrijk om de basiswoorden te kennen die je op elke bruiloft tegenkomt.

<VocabCard
  word="Wedding"
  translation="Bruiloft / Huwelijk"
  pronunciation="WED-ding"
  example="Their wedding was absolutely beautiful."
/>

| Engels | Nederlands | Uitspraak |
|--------|------------|-----------|
| Bride | Bruid | BRAID |
| Groom | Bruidegom | GROEM |
| Wedding ceremony | Huwelijksceremonie | WED-ding SE-re-mo-nie |
| Wedding reception | Bruiloftsreceptie | WED-ding ri-SEP-sjun |
| Vows | Geloften | VAUS |
| Wedding rings | Trouwringen | WED-ding RINGS |
| Best man | Getuige (bruidegom) | BEST men |
| Maid of honor | Getuige (bruid) | MEID of ON-ner |
| Bridesmaid | Bruidsmeisje | BRAIDS-meid |
| Groomsman | Vriend van de bruidegom | GROEMS-men |
| Flower girl | Bloemenmeisje | FLAU-er gerl |
| Ring bearer | Ringdrager | RING BER-er |

<CultureTip flag="üá¨üáß" title="Britse Bruiloftstraditie">
In het Verenigd Koninkrijk is het een traditie dat de bruid "something old, something new, something borrowed, something blue" draagt. Dit symboliseert continu√Øteit, optimisme, geleend geluk en trouw. Het is een mooie traditie om over te praten met je Engelstalige partner!
</CultureTip>

## De Huwelijksceremonie

### Tijdens de Geloften

De geloften zijn het emotionele hoogtepunt van elke bruiloft. Hier zijn de meest gebruikte zinnen:

<VocabCard
  word="I do"
  translation="Ja, ik wil"
  pronunciation="AI doe"
  example="When the officiant asks, you simply say 'I do.'"
/>

| Engels | Nederlands | Wanneer te gebruiken |
|--------|------------|---------------------|
| I take you to be my wife/husband | Ik neem jou als mijn vrouw/man | In de traditionele geloften |
| To have and to hold | Om te hebben en te houden | Onderdeel van de geloften |
| From this day forward | Vanaf deze dag | Begin van de belofte |
| For better, for worse | In goede en slechte tijden | Traditionele belofte |
| For richer, for poorer | In rijkdom en armoede | Traditionele belofte |
| In sickness and in health | In ziekte en gezondheid | Traditionele belofte |
| To love and to cherish | Om lief te hebben en te koesteren | Kern van de belofte |
| Till death do us part | Tot de dood ons scheidt | Traditioneel einde |
| With this ring, I thee wed | Met deze ring trouw ik met jou | Bij het uitwisselen van ringen |

<VocabCard
  word="You may now kiss the bride"
  translation="Je mag nu de bruid kussen"
  pronunciation="Joe mei nau KIS de braid"
  example="The officiant smiled and said, 'You may now kiss the bride.'"
/>

## Felicitaties voor het Bruidspaar

Na de ceremonie is het tijd om het bruidspaar te feliciteren. Hier zijn warme en hartelijke uitdrukkingen:

### Korte Felicitaties

| Engels | Nederlands |
|--------|------------|
| Congratulations! | Gefeliciteerd! |
| Best wishes! | Beste wensen! |
| Wishing you a lifetime of happiness | Ik wens jullie een leven vol geluk |
| May your love grow stronger each day | Moge jullie liefde elke dag sterker worden |
| Here's to love and laughter | Op liefde en gelach |
| Cheers to the happy couple | Proost op het gelukkige paar |

### Langere Felicitaties voor Kaarten

<VocabCard
  word="May your marriage be filled with all the right ingredients: love, understanding, respect, and laughter"
  translation="Moge jullie huwelijk gevuld zijn met alle juiste ingredi√´nten: liefde, begrip, respect en gelach"
  pronunciation="Mei joor ME-ridsj bie FILD wid ol de RAIT in-GRIE-dients"
  example="Dit schrijf je in een huwelijkskaart"
/>

Meer mooie zinnen voor huwelijkskaarten:

- **"Wishing you a wonderful journey as you build your new life together"** - Een prachtige reis gewenst terwijl jullie samen je nieuwe leven opbouwen
- **"May today be the beginning of a long, happy life together"** - Moge vandaag het begin zijn van een lang, gelukkig leven samen
- **"Your love story is just beginning"** - Jullie liefdesverhaal begint nu pas
- **"Two hearts, one love"** - Twee harten, √©√©n liefde

<CultureTip flag="üá¨üáß" title="Huwelijkscadeaus">
In Engelstalige landen is het gebruikelijk om een "wedding registry" te hebben - een lijst bij winkels waar gasten cadeaus kunnen uitkiezen. Het is ook populair om geld te geven met de kaart. Zinnen als "Wishing you well as you start your new life together" zijn perfect bij een geldgeschenk.
</CultureTip>

## De Bruiloftstoast

Als je wordt gevraagd een toast uit te brengen, zijn hier enkele zinnen die je kunt gebruiken:

<VocabCard
  word="Please raise your glasses"
  translation="Wil iedereen het glas heffen"
  pronunciation="Plies REIS joor GLA-ses"
  example="Gebruik dit om de toast te beginnen"
/>

### Structuur van een Toast

1. **Opening**: "Ladies and gentlemen" (Dames en heren)
2. **Introductie**: "I'd like to propose a toast" (Ik wil graag een toast uitbrengen)
3. **Persoonlijk verhaal**: "I remember when..." (Ik herinner me toen...)
4. **Complimenten**: "[Name] is such a wonderful person" ([Naam] is zo'n geweldig persoon)
5. **Wens**: "May your love last forever" (Moge jullie liefde eeuwig duren)
6. **Afsluiting**: "To the bride and groom!" (Op het bruidspaar!)

### Populaire Toastuitdrukkingen

| Engels | Nederlands |
|--------|------------|
| To love, laughter, and happily ever after | Op liefde, gelach en nog lang en gelukkig |
| May your love be modern enough to survive the times, and old-fashioned enough to last forever | Moge jullie liefde modern genoeg zijn om de tijd te doorstaan, en ouderwets genoeg om eeuwig te duren |
| Here's to the bride and groom | Op het bruidspaar |
| To a lifetime of love and happiness | Op een leven vol liefde en geluk |

## Dansen en Feesten

Na de formele gedeelten komt het feest! Hier zijn zinnen voor op de dansvloer:

<VocabCard
  word="May I have this dance?"
  translation="Mag ik deze dans van je?"
  pronunciation="Mei ai hev dis DANS"
  example="Een romantische manier om je partner ten dans te vragen"
/>

| Engels | Nederlands |
|--------|------------|
| First dance | Openingsdans |
| Father-daughter dance | Vader-dochter dans |
| Mother-son dance | Moeder-zoon dans |
| Let's dance! | Laten we dansen! |
| You look beautiful tonight | Je ziet er prachtig uit vanavond |
| This song reminds me of us | Dit liedje doet me aan ons denken |

## Praktische Zinnen voor de Bruiloft

### Bij de Receptie

| Engels | Nederlands | Uitspraak |
|--------|------------|-----------|
| Where is the seating chart? | Waar is de tafelschikking? | WER is de SIE-ting tsjart |
| Beautiful venue | Prachtige locatie | BJOE-ti-ful VEN-joe |
| The ceremony was lovely | De ceremonie was prachtig | De SE-re-mo-nie wos LUV-lie |
| They make a perfect couple | Ze zijn een perfect paar | Dei meik e PER-fekt KUP-pel |
| I'm so happy for you both | Ik ben zo blij voor jullie beiden | Aim so HEP-pie for joe bouth |

### Emotionele Momenten

<VocabCard
  word="I'm so moved"
  translation="Ik ben zo ontroerd"
  pronunciation="Aim so MOEVD"
  example="You can say this during emotional moments like the vows."
/>

| Engels | Nederlands |
|--------|------------|
| I'm getting emotional | Ik word emotioneel |
| That was so touching | Dat was zo ontroerend |
| I have tears of joy | Ik heb tranen van geluk |
| What a beautiful ceremony | Wat een prachtige ceremonie |
| Love is in the air | Liefde hangt in de lucht |

## Je Eigen Geloften Schrijven

Als je je eigen geloften wilt schrijven in het Engels, zijn hier enkele handige zinnen en structuren:

### Opening

- "From the moment I met you..." - Vanaf het moment dat ik je ontmoette...
- "I knew you were special when..." - Ik wist dat je bijzonder was toen...
- "Standing here today..." - Hier vandaag staand...

### Het Midden

- "I promise to..." - Ik beloof om...
- "I will always..." - Ik zal altijd...
- "Together we will..." - Samen zullen we...
- "You make me want to be a better person" - Jij maakt dat ik een beter persoon wil zijn
- "With you, I have found my home" - Bij jou heb ik mijn thuis gevonden

### Afsluiting

- "I choose you today, tomorrow, and forever" - Ik kies voor jou vandaag, morgen en voor altijd
- "You are my best friend, my soulmate, my everything" - Jij bent mijn beste vriend, mijn zielsverwant, mijn alles
- **"I can't wait to spend the rest of my life with you"** - Ik kan niet wachten om de rest van mijn leven met jou door te brengen

<CultureTip flag="üá¨üáß" title="Persoonlijke Geloften">
In moderne Engelstalige bruiloften is het steeds populairder om zelf je geloften te schrijven. Dit kan grappig, emotioneel, of een mix van beide zijn. Het belangrijkste is dat het authentiek en van het hart komt. Bespreek van tevoren met je partner of jullie dit samen doen!
</CultureTip>

## Veelgemaakte Fouten Vermijden

Als Nederlandstalige zijn er enkele valkuilen bij het uitspreken van Engelse huwelijkszinnen:

| Fout | Correct | Tip |
|------|---------|-----|
| "I wish you much happiness" | "I wish you happiness" of "I wish you all the happiness" | Geen "much" met ontelbare zelfstandige naamwoorden |
| "Congratulations with your wedding" | "Congratulations on your wedding" | Gebruik "on" niet "with" |
| "They are married since 2020" | "They have been married since 2020" | Gebruik "have been" bij "since" |

## Tot Slot

Het kunnen uitdrukken van je gevoelens in het Engels op zo'n speciale dag als een bruiloft is echt waardevol. Of je nu je eigen huwelijk viert met een Engelstalige partner, of je bent te gast op een Engelse bruiloft - deze zinnen helpen je om de juiste woorden te vinden voor elk moment.

Vergeet niet dat het niet gaat om perfect Engels te spreken, maar om oprechte gevoelens te delen. Je partner en de andere gasten zullen je inzet waarderen, ook als je accent niet perfect is!

Wil je meer romantische Engelse uitdrukkingen leren? Bekijk onze gids over [romantische Engelse zinnen](/nl/blog/romantic-english-phrases-for-couples) of leer de [100 meest voorkomende Engelse woorden](/nl/blog/100-most-common-english-words) om je basis te versterken.
